title: Clarifies additional_bq_parameters argument in WriteToBigquery docstring
body:
The docstring for the Python `WriteToBigquery` PTransform only mentions that `additional_bq_parameters` can be a callable while it can also be a `dict` (as shown in [the example at the top of the file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c1719476b74ec6f68fabea392087607adafc70ef/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L177-L188)). This is also reflected in some other docstrings that include `additional_bq_parameters` ([example](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c1719476b74ec6f68fabea392087607adafc70ef/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L712)). I believe that for load jobs, it can also be a `ValueProvider` ([code](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/c1719476b74ec6f68fabea392087607adafc70ef/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery_file_loads.py#L394)), but not for streaming inserts. So wasn't sure whether to include this. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. (N/A) - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. (N/A) - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [GoSDK Infra] Bugfix: Parallelism ignored when using endpoint flag.
body:
The parallelism flag is intended to be ignored when using Flink, Spark, or Samza runners, but due to a bug, this wasn't happening if one of those runners was used with an endpoint address instead of a job server jar. title: [BEAM-12802] Refactor DataStreamsDecoder so that it becomes aware of the ByteString iterator and in the future will be able to answer whether there is data available or do we need to fetch more data.
body:
This is towards breaking up https://github.com/lukecwik/incubator-beam/commit/936b2e3075787c62354466ba1f4d2ec841d2e65d and submitting useful pieces incrementally. Note that we can simplify the implementation within `Inbound` since we know that we are using ByteString and hence are guaranteed certain properties of the input stream are guaranteed, see https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/java/com/google/protobuf/ByteString.html#newInput-- for more details. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12798] Add configurable combiner packing limit
body:
Currently translations.pack_combiners has no upper limit, which means it can potentially pack thousands of combiners together, which may cause OOM issues if the accumulators are large. This limits combiner packing to 128 combiners by default. Users can override this limit by setting the annotation's value to an integer. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10913] - Adding new Grafana dashboard to monitor GAs post-commit tests status
body:
This PR is comprised of the changes required to graph the results of the GAs tests which run against the Apache Beam repository. Below is a screenshot of how the dashboard looks. ![Screen Shot 2021-08-25 at 13 39 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80284146/130854108-378c2474-d8ed-4a3e-bcce-6e59c6cdb709.png) The data being shown is pulled by Grafana (via a plugin) from the GitHub REST API. The plugin ([JSON API](https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/marcusolsson-json-datasource/)) is setup in the .test-infra/metrics/docker-compose.yml file. R: Hi Ahmet @aaltay ! title: [BEAM-12742] SamzaTimerInternalsFactory#deleteTimer(TimerData) does not properly delete timers
body:
SamzaTimerInternalsFactory relies deleteTimer(TimerData timerData) as its final implementation to delete timers, however this is a deprecated because of the timestamp value inside TimerData during deletion is not set/reliable. Therefore following changes has been made: 1. Update SamzaTimerInternalsFactory#deleteTimer to depend on key fields only, i.e. StateNamespace, TimerId, TimerFamilyId and TimeDomain. 2. Read from state on timestamp and output timestamp in order to properly delete. 3. Enable test_pardo_timers_clear tests to test the cases where timers are supposed to be cleared/deleted 4. Refactor interfaces to better organize the code. Tested with `./gradlew :sdks:python:test-suites:portable:py36:samzaCompatibilityMatrixLOOPBACK --rerun-tasks` **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12795] In preparation for implementing BEAM-12795, create a new ParDo primitive
body:
In order to implement BEAM-12795, we need to add non-trivial expansion to ParDo.MultiOuput. This cannot be done today since runners treat MultiOutput as a primitive and replace it wholesale. In this PR we create a new ParDo.MultiOutputPrimitive and update runners to replace that instead.

All runners in the Beam codebase have been updated. Any runners outside the Beam codebase will need to start replacing MultiOutputPrimitive before updating to the next Beam release.

title: [BEAM-10990] Elasticsearch response filtering and [BEAM-5172] Tries to reduce ES UTest flakiness
body:
Adds the ability to prevent infinite retries with non-transient Elasticsearch write failures by providing a user-configurable setting called (for now, I'm not certain the name is perfect) `withThrowWriteFailures`, which is `true` by default to maintain backward compatibility. If `withThrowWriteFailures` is set to `false`, the response from Elasticsearch Bulk API will be used to capture the result of persisting a document (or deleting it). The order of Bulk API response is guaranteed to be in the same order as the Bulk API request[1], so we can stitch together what the write result of a given input document was. This PR introduces a new class `WriteSummary`. This class is used to collect the context of a document as it passes from raw input document (i.e. the PCollection being sent to ElasticsearchIO.Write/ElasticsearchIO.DocToBulk), the Bulk Directive which resulted from transform settings and the input document (ex. delete directive, upsert, scripted upsert, etc), as well as whether the document resulted in an error from ES. By maintaining all the context/ancestry of the document, users can get at the input document and its resulting error, for example. Without maintaining the ancestry, we could only return the Bulk Directive which would be less helpful in many cases. [1] https://discuss.elastic.co/t/ordering-of-responses-in-the-bulk-api/13264 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [RFC] Define and document per-key ordering semantics for runners
body:
There are various use cases that can be implemented on top of Beam and its runners, but that need certain guarantees regarding the ordered transport of data in between execution stages/steps of a Beam Pipeline. This PR proposes the following: - Defining the concept of per-key ordered delivery. - `ValidatesRunner` tests that allow us to verify runner behavior for per-key ordered delivery. - Adding a row to the Beam Capability Matrix where runner support for this is documented. With this, Beam users will be able to enable various order-dependent workloads on Beam/Dataflow with confidence that they need. ----- Results form ValidatesRunner tests: - Flink streaming VR tests: [Build Scan](https://scans.gradle.com/s/x4whlt2gchcum/tests#:runners:flink:1.13:job-server-validatesportablerunnerstreaming-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms-perkeyorderingtest) - Flink Bartch VR tests: [Jenkins output](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_PVR_Flink_Batch_PR/261/console) - not running any of the new tests, as it does not support key-ordered delivery. - Dataflow legacy VR tests: [Build Scan](https://scans.gradle.com/s/pcww3rqmcmu24/tests#:runners:google-cloud-dataflow-java-validatesrunnerlegacyworkertest-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms-perkeyorderingtest) - Direct VR tests: [Build Scan](https://scans.gradle.com/s/45pjufvncnoq6/tests#:runners:direct-java-validatesrunner-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms-perkeyorderingtest) - Samza tests: [Build Scan]( https://scans.gradle.com/s/npxbjepkaliqk/tests#:runners:samza-validatesrunner-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms-perkeyorderingtest) -------------------------------------------- r: @apilloud r: @kennknowles --------------------------------------------------------

title: [Go SDK] Go SDK Exits Experimental
body:

title: [BEAM-8571] Release Go SDK containers, and use them.
body:
* Adds Go SDK containers back to the release scripts. * Have released versions of the Go SDK use the matching container. Only issues are around release validation: we don't update that string manually, so release validation users will need to manually specify the RC container when validating Go SDK releases. Similarly, SDK developers will likely need to manually specify the "latest" container, as the dev builds aren't guaranteed to exist (not all devs need/want to modify the boot container code.) Test scripts all presently pass in containers manually so this doesn't change that, only when a container is not provided. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12781] Add memoization of BoundedSource encoding for SDFBoundedSourceReader
body:
The SDFBoundedSourceReader was running extremely slowly, especially for `ReadFromBigQuery` pipelines that had many splits (1TB returns ~5k splits - this was giving us an overhead of 1000 seconds vs alternatives). After debugging, I figured out that `SDFBoundedSourceReader` implementation along with SDF expansion (`PairWithRestriction -> InitialSplits -> ProcessSplits`) was causing us to pickle-encode custom `BoundedSource` instances repeatedly. For BQ, this was `_CustomBigQuerySource` being pickled once for every split (for thousands of splits), so this was adding up. I created a pickle coder that memoizes results, and used it (so far) only in this transform. This allowed us to reduce the cost of repeatedly encoding the sources. This should fix other instances of the same issue (e.g. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15185). r: @robertwb fyi @satybald @chunyang ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12740] Remove matching to filter files when renaming gcs files in the same bucket
body:
Matching involves additional GCS metadata operations. The existing filtering in FileSystems skips the rename if the destination exists and the checksum matches. However such existence is not the common case, and the rewrite operation is metadata only if the object is within the same location and storage class. We restrict to the same bucket for simplicity and it is the expected case with FileIO.write Unsupported cheap renames fallback to filtering with in FileSystems. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Allow google-auth < 3
body:
`google-auth` recently published a 2.0.0 release which removed support for Python 2.7. `google-auth` now requires Python >=3.6. No other breaking changes were made. You can see the full list of changes [here](https://github.com/googleapis/google-auth-library-python/commit/560cf1ed02a900436c5d9e0a0fb3f94b5fd98c55). I am opening PRs to expand google-auth version ranges for packages that meet either of the following criteria: * Package has >10,000 monthly downloads as of June 2021 * Package is owned by a Google team `google-auth` is a dependency of many different libraries that interact with Google APIs. Increasing the time and number of packages with compatible pins on `google-auth` lowers the chance end developers who use multiple libraries will see dependency conflicts. If possible, please do not require `google-auth>=2.0.0` until this issue is resolved https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-python/issues/10566, as that will further reduce the likelihood of diamond dependency conflicts. Googlers, see [this doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1euAvUsia_4zf98lNvpwA3K0o2b4y5Xr9xAkyzCnIMzQ/edit) for more information. title: [BEAM-9487] Disable allowing unsafe triggers by default
body:
In the release notes for Beam 2.31, there were two deprecations mentioned that affect GroupByKey in the Python SDK: ``` * Python GBK will stop supporting unbounded PCollections that have global windowing and a default trigger in Beam 2.33. This can be overriden with `--allow_unsafe_triggers`. ([BEAM-9487](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9487)). * Python GBK will start requiring safe triggers or the `--allow_unsafe_triggers` flag starting with Beam 2.33. ([BEAM-9487](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9487)). ``` This PR making that change in anticipation of the upcoming Beam 2.33 release. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12763] Remove redundant build from copy path in copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses rule
body:
Without this change a redundant `/build/` appears on the copy path, leading to the rule doing nothing. Before, after clearing `sdks/java/container/build` and `sdks/java/container/java8/build`. ``` > Task :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses NO-SOURCE file or directory '/home/rebo/git/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/java/container/build/build/target/third_party_licenses', not found Skipping task ':sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses' as it has no source files and no previous output files. :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses (Thread[Execution worker for ':',5,main]) completed. Took 0.0 secs. :sdks:java:container:java8:dockerPrepare (Thread[Execution worker for ':',5,main]) started. ``` The job then fails to build the Dockerfile. ``` Step 13/18 : ADD target/third_party_licenses /opt/apache/beam/third_party_licenses/ ADD failed: stat /var/lib/docker/tmp/docker-builder213254890/target/third_party_licenses: no such file or directory ``` However, a subsequent run succeeds but still produces the same error: ``` > Task :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses NO-SOURCE file or directory '/home/rebo/git/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/java/container/build/build/target/third_party_licenses', not found Skipping task ':sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses' as it has no source files and no previous output files. :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 3,5,main]) completed. Took 0.0 secs. :sdks:java:container:java8:copyLicenses (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 3,5,main]) started. ``` It's not clear why the 2nd run succeeds at all, or how the license files are making it the second time around, however, this PR resolves the issue immeadiately. After the fix in this PR, the rule produces the following ``` > Task :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses Caching disabled for task ':sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses' because: Caching has not been enabled for the task Task ':sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses' is not up-to-date because: No history is available. Watching 12568 directories to track changes Watching 12859 directories to track changes :sdks:java:container:java8:copyJavaThirdPartyLicenses (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 3,5,main]) completed. Took 0.341 secs. :sdks:java:container:java8:copyDockerfileDependencies (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 3,5,main]) started. ``` and the Dockerfile succeeds on the first try. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12751] Set clientRequestId for Dataflow python job creation
body:
Current Dataflow pipeline python runner doesn't specify clientRequestId which causes job creation API retry to fail with "There is already an active job named...". Java runner doesn't have this issue as it [sets clientRequestId](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/v2.31.0/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowRunner.java#L981-L994) properly. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12754] Only call getValue once per field per row
body:
RowCoderGenerator.encodeDelegate can be optimized to only call getValue once per field, rather than twice that it does now. Currently it'll call getValue once in scanNullFields to find if the field is null, and then another time to actually encode the value. This can add unnecessary overhead if `getValue` needs to do expensive operations to transform the wrapped value to a beam Row value (for example, recursively translating a map or Row). title: [BEAM-5379] Go SDK modules support.
body:
This PR adds module support to the Go SDK. Currently it is split into multiple commits, and **I strongly suggest reviewing it one commit at a time**. The commits are as follows: 1. Go modules basic support and upgrade to Go 1.16.5. - This is the addition of basic module support, along with getting gogradle to work with modules. - I placed the module in the /sdks subdirectory. While my first instinct was to put it in the root directory, this didn't play well with the /vendor subdirectory. - This commit does not update the module to /v2 yet, although that's required. I saved that for a separate commit. 2. Go Jenkins tests adjusted to use modules. - This does some fixup to the gradle files and adjusts the validates runner test script to (hopefully) work on Jenkins. Whether it works we'll find out when we run postcommits on this PR. 3. Add /v2/ to go module path and update references. - This commit adds v2 to the module path and attempts to update all references. Basically just a lot of search and replace. I may have missed some spots but it will probably be easier to find out through usage. - I avoided changing references outside of the module as much as I could. So things like the website and katas are not updated. 4. Fix Go SDK proto generation, and update protos. - I had to make some fixes to proto generation to account for the addition of /v2/ to the module path. While I was at it I ended up updating the version of protoc-gen-go used and updated the instructions. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12741] Python IO text: add ReadAllFromTextWithFilename transform.
body:
A new transform `io.textio.ReadAllFromTextWithFilename` extends `ReadAllFromText` transform to produce a `PCollection` of tuples of name of the file and lines of the file. This can be useful if lines from multiple files need to be mapped to something like column headers based on the files from which they originate. ------------------------ - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
